description: I don't know what you did to duck this program so bad, but not even a full month ago, I was able to install programs using a CD. Now, the option is missing and I can't install it. For some unspecified reason, when I set the game to install off the exe on the CD I'm trying to use, it gives me a warning telling me I don't have permissions to write to the CD. This is stupid because I'm trying to read off the disk, no write. Fix your delightfully broken program. I shouldn't have to pirate an ISO file to install a game I own the disk for just because you decided I shouldn't be allowed to install off the CD.

description: i installed Lutris and was up and running instantly. big ups to the developers you guys are freaking awesome
Update it to the latest Lutris ver.

First thing you should do on any Ubuntu based system if you game, well, at least I do this and it works every time. Google "Lutris Nvidia drivers" and there is a wiki for Lutris that gives you the apt commands to install latest 440 drivers. Do all of it. After, search "foss latest Wine Ubuntu" and follow his instructions for latest Wine. There are other ways, this is just how I do it and games work just fine after I do all this, and then install Lutris.
not working with zorin os

This is awesome today. Games work for me about the same as Steam/Proton. You can even select Proton in Lutris or use from Steam. How cool is that?!

I don't recommend installing from here however as the maintainer is a bit too slow to update releases. As I write this, its about a week so far behind the official release and counting. Its unknown when it will be updated.

Just git clone from the github code (then use git to update it anytime you want to update and you get the latest anytime you want, or don't update if you don't want to). You don't build the git source nor do you install it.

Just create a desktop shortcut to /home/yourUser/lutris/bin/lutris and use the provided svg icon in the source. Then you have it in applications with no installation. You can find the shortcuts in ~/.local/share/applications/ and just copy paste one that has short contents like Nvidia settings shortcut and edit it with the necessary changes.

If you want it fully automatic but behind release by unknown amount of time, then just install here from Software. I had to update as the newest version fixed some problems. Probably after 1.0 release when its more stable, I might use Software install again.
summary: I don't recommend from distro however as it can be a bit behind

description:
If you're looking to use Lutris for Windows games, it's the best option for everything outside of Steam. You can even use it to install the Epic Games Store.

Where it feels a bit lacking is when it comes to non-Windows games. Trying to play old PS2 games is not a fun experience. I've also had a tough time trying to get Lutris to recognize my steam library. I'd like to use Lutris as my main game launcher.
Useful, but not user friendly.

I do use Lutris for installing and playing Windows games from GoG and it works well. Some Windows games run great, some have issues, but in general the Lutris does an amazing job of simplifying windows gaming experience on Linux.
I love that Lutris actually contains multiple Wine versions with different patches that are chosen to provide the optimal experience with a particular game and all this complexity is hidden and most of my games just work out of the box.
summary: Great application how to run Windows games

description: In just few clicks this tool completly automates nearly any non linux game to run smoothly on Linux. Great tool. Great developers

The FPS counter (Mangohub) doesn't is disabled by default and can't be changed, even if you install Mangohub from source.

I got it working by right clicking in each game, going to configure --> System options, environment variables section and adding key: MANGOHUD and Value: 1
Just type "MANGOHUD" not "key: MANGOHUD"

I tried to use this before in early 2021, and had no luck. The application and Flatpak has since had a lot of work done to it and now it works fantastically. Make sure you install the Wine add-on for Lutris as well to have a default runner. Otherwise you'll need to install a different runner.

The winetricks bundled with it (possibly the Wine add-on) only works for the version of Wine default with the add-on.

description:
Tracking feature that displays all games in Steam, GOG, Origin.

Most games launch perfectly, but some games have Issues because of Wine and bad Integration onto Linux. 

Overall, good app with a few bugs that can be overlooked.

Steam Deck users:

After installing the flatpak, open a terminal (Konsole) and run:

flatpak install flathub org.gnome.Platform.Compat.i386 org.freedesktop.Platform.GL32.default org.freedesktop.Platform.GL.default

It will prompt you multiple times. Select the last option every time. Finally, type 'y' to install the combatibility layer.

Die Version hier im Store ist veraltet, doch die neuere auf Github fungtioniert perfekt. Meine Spiele liefen nichtmal mit Steam Proton so performant, wie mit Lutris. Ich liebe es.

Lo genial de Lutris es que une y facilita la ejecución y configuración de varios software para ejecutar juegos (capas de compatibilidad, emuladores, launchers, etc.) en una sola front-end, sin embargo, tienen que tener en cuenta unas cosas:

- Si estás usando Wine/Proton, no olvides que estás ejecutando juegos que NO SON NATIVOS DE LINUX, por ende, errores de compatibilidad son normal. Steam con Proton ha hecho una enorme contribución al respecto, pero no esperen milagros, si el juego no corre, pues no corre, no es culpa de Lutris ni de Linux, esperen una próxima actualización de Wine/Proton para probar de vuelta, o simplemente prueben con otros juegos que se sepa funcionan bien.

- Juegos que usan un solo archivo como instalador con todo y sin DRM (como los de GOG) son los mejorcitos. No olvides bajar la última versión de Proton en la interfaz del programa para ello, pones el mouse donde dice Wine, le das a la cajita, y ahí eliges el que veas más actualizado, ahí también sale Wine normal y algunos modificados para juegos en especifico.

- En Steam es relativamente común encontrar juegos nativos para Linux, todos los de Valve lo están, por ejemplo, así que si puedes evitar capas de compatibilidad, mejor.

- Mientras más antiguo, mejor, sobretodo si lo puedes jalar de un emulador y cuentas con el ROM. También van de maravilla los juegos de 32bits pensados para la Windows XP. Así que puede ser una buena alternativa para aquellos que se pasaron a Linux precisamente por no tener una computadora de buenos recursos.
summary: Super recomendable si eres newbie, pero no lo sobre-estimen

description: J'adore trés fonctionnel et simple de configuration, il fonctionne parfaitement avec la plupart des applications et jeux que j'utilise.
fake programming

La plupart de mes jeux Windows marchent sans trop de problèmes, tant qu'ils n'utilisent pas d'anti-cheat douteux ou autre.
Vous pouvez essayer de lancer votre jeu même si il n'a pas d'installateur custom sur le site, ça marche surprenamment souvent
Pour moi, A Plague Tale : Innocence, Death's Door, Inscryption et Potion Craft ont marchés avec l'installateur par défaut (gog).

Le truc c'est que dans la dernière version (0.5.9.1), un message d'erreur s'affiche par dessus l'interface et empêche de télécharger avec le script par défaut. 
Ça se contourne en déplaçant le popup (avec la barre de titre, oui oui, me demandez pas pourquoi) derrière le message d'erreur, validant le message d'erreur, puis installant. Mais un utilisateur lambda pensera simplement qu'il ne peut pas installer.
summary: Très bien mais bug gênant une fonctionnalité
